title: Queens man with gang ties facing negligent homicide charges after accidentally shooting friend to death
content:
A 29-year-old Queens man was arrested in the fatal shooting of a friend during a night of drinking and playfighting, police said.
Christian Penaloza, 29, of Corona, was hanging out in his basement apartment on National St. near 45th Ave. with Rufino Perez Villa, 24, when they began playfighting Sunday night, cops said. Penaloza pulled out a shotgun and it went off, mortally wounding the victim at about 7:45 p.m.
Penaloza told cops he was showing the victim the muzzle of the weapon when it fired, sources said. The victim was hit in the chest.
Penaloza and another friend, John Zhumi, carried Perez Villanout of the apartment to the corner, where Zhumi called 911, sources said.
Cops arrived on a report of a stabbing and stopped the two men when they spotted blood on their clothing.
Paramedics took Perez Villa to Elmhurst Hospital, where he died Monday.
Penaloza was charged with criminally negligent homicide, rather than murder, because police could not show he intended to shoot the victim, a law enforcement source said.
“It was just an accident, he didn‘t intend to hurt anybody,” said Penaloza’s 18-year-old sister, who declined to give her name.
Penaloza has 22 prior arrests on charges including drugs, burglary, assault, criminal mischief and robbery, police said. He is a member of a gang called the “Flip the Paper Crew,” a law enforcement source said.
Zhumi was also arrested — on two open warrants stemming from arrests in October and November.
